parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game6</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version6</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Display a resource defined in RscTitles of the mission's [[Description.ext]], the campaign's description.ext or the global config.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>For greater efficiency and ease of modability, it is recommended to use named layers available with alternative syntax since Arma 3 v1.57.134673.</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Important</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>To avoid conflicts with existing layers it is recommended to register a layer with '''BIS_fnc_rscLayer''' and to start the name with a TAG:<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>("TAG_myLayer" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]]) [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc","PLAIN"];</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>ic</title><part><name index="1"/><value>"TAG_myLayer" [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc","PLAIN"];</value></part></template></value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''cutRsc''' [class, effect, speed, showInMap]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> [class, effect, speed, showInMap]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> effect: [[String]] - one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.

</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> speed (Optional, default -1): [[Number]] - Time in seconds to fade in resource.

</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> showInMap (Optional, default [[true]]): [[Boolean]] - [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened.

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> layer '''cutRsc''' [class, effect, speed, showInMap]

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> layer: [[Number]] or [[String]]
* [[Number]] - layer number on which the effect is shown, where 0 is the back most. Layer number is rounded to the nearest integer and also cannot be negative. Layer 99.5 will be treated as layer 100
* [[String]] - layer name on which the effect is shown. Layer names are '''CaSe SeNsItIvE'''.

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [class, effect, speed, showInMap]: [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> class: [[String]] - the class name of the resource. ("Default" will remove the current resource.)

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> effect: [[String]] - one of "PLAIN", "PLAIN DOWN", "BLACK", "BLACK FADED", "BLACK OUT", "BLACK IN", "WHITE OUT" and "WHITE IN". See [[Title Effect Type]]s for more information about these values.

</value></part><part><name>p25</name>=<value> speed: [[Number]] - (Optional, default -1) Time in seconds to fade in resource.

</value></part><part><name>p26</name>=<value> showInMap: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to hide the text when the map is opened.

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN"];
[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];
[[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2, [[false]]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>2 [[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> <code>_layer = "layer1" [[cutRsc]] ["binocular", "PLAIN", 2];</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> <code><template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Create IGUI display</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Such display can be closed with [[closeDisplay]] command or by overwriting the same cut layer with another output.</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Note that "Unload" EH for some reason does not work with such display.</value></part></template>
"someLayer" [[cutRsc]] ["RscTitleDisplayEmpty", "PLAIN"];
[[private]] _display <template><title>=</title></template> [[uiNamespace]] [[getVariable]] "RscTitleDisplayEmpty";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[allCutLayers]], [[titleRsc]], [[cutText]], [[cutObj]], [[cutFadeOut]], [[setTitleEffect]], [[allActiveTitleEffects]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 30 Jun, 2008</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Dr_Eyeball|Dr_Eyeball]]<dd class="note">
Using [[cutRsc]] (instead of [[titleRsc]]) for a HUD has the benefits of:
* having the HUD automatically hide itself when you access the map and redisplay itself after closing the map.<BR>
* using the 'Direct communication' chat channel messages will not interfere with the HUD by hiding it.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 17 Oct, 2013</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]<dd class="note">
Regarding removing current resource with [[cutRsc]] ["Default", "PLAIN"]. If it does't work and it gives you error message that "Default" is not found, add it by yourself to RscTitles in [[description.ext]] so it looks like this:
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang="cpp"</attr><inner>
class RscTitles
{
	class Default 
	{
		idd = -1;
		fadein = 0;
		fadeout = 0;
		duration = 0;
	};
};
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>

Alternatively, you can use cutText, yes [[cutText]] command to cancel your resources. As Karel Moricky explains: "All 'cut' commands are in the same layer, the same as all 'title' commands are in another one." So to remove cutRsc resource execute cutText on the same layer:

<code>[[cutRsc]] ["myRsc", "PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>show</value></part></template>
[[cutText]] ["", "PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>remove</value></part></template></code>

<code>10 [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc", "PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>show</value></part></template>
10 [[cutText]] ["", "PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>remove</value></part></template></code>

Also if you use layers would be a good idea to register them with [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]] to avoid possible clashes with other layers:
<code>("myLayerName" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]]) [[cutRsc]] ["myRsc","PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>show</value></part></template>
("myLayerName" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_rscLayer]]) [[cutText]] ["","PLAIN"]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>remove</value></part></template></code>

You can also immediately remove resource with [[cutFadeOut]] command:<code>123 [[cutFadeOut]] 0;</code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
